origin.text: Forged in {place} during {event}, under sleepless prayers and a vow that no bell would ring in surrender.
Quenched in mud and blood at {place} when the lines broke and oaths became the only shelter left.
Woven from a promise traded at a moonlit crossroads near {place}, where the air tastes of lilies and lies.
Bound in the vaults of {place} with ink that refuses to dry, meant to outlast every honest forgetfulness.
Raised from a salt-sunk reliquary off {place}, crusted in sea-silver and old prayers.
Kindled in gravefire beneath {place}, where the dead keep careful accounts and no debt stays buried.
Commissioned by {faction} in {place}, built to endure hard hands, harder weather, and harder choices.
Struck to shape during a storm that never moved on from {place}, each thunderclap leaving a hidden signature.
Passed hand to hand through the backstreets of {place}, gathering stories like soot gathers on glass.
